thread.title: Broward County Public Schools Superintendent Robert W. Runcie Leads 5th Annual Fort Lauderdale Turkey Trot and Paddle, Benefiting iTrace Foundation, Inc. and the Leadership Broward Foundation, Inc.
thread.title_full: Broward County Public Schools Superintendent Robert W. Runcie Leads 5th Annual Fort Lauderdale Turkey Trot and Paddle, Benefiting iTrace Foundation, Inc. and the Leadership Broward Foundation, Inc. - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Broward County Public Schools Superintendent Robert W. Runcie Leads 5th Annual Fort Lauderdale Turkey Trot and Paddle, Benefiting iTrace Foundation, Inc. and the Leadership Broward Foundation, Inc.
text:
Leadership Broward Foundation, Inc.
FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. , Oct. 22,2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Healthy living is something many people advocate for, but some choose to take it one step further and lead by example. Join Grand Marshall Robert W. Runcie, Superintendent of Broward County Public Schools, as he leads by example on Thanksgiving morning when he and thousands of fellow Floridians tackle the 5th Annual Fort Lauderdale Turkey Trot and Paddle on Fort Lauderdale Beach.
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20151022/279753
"Every day, teachers and administrators across Broward County Public Schools work to educate our students on the importance of living a healthy lifestyle," said Superintendent Runcie. "The Turkey Trot is an opportunity to show Broward youth, as well as our entire community, that fitness can be fun, and it's all for a good cause."
The 5 th Annual 2015 Turkey Trot and Paddle will support two local community organizations committed to developing leadership, inspiring community service, and promoting health and wellness - iTRACE Foundation, Inc. , a preventative health and wellness research foundation and the Leadership Broward Foundation, Inc ., committed to inspiring community service and leadership development.
"I'm looking forward to seeing the community come together. It doesn't matter if you walk, run or paddle â€“ this is a great way to enjoy the outdoors, get exercise and help others at the same time," said Runcie.
The 5 th Annual Turkey Trot and Paddle kicks off at 7:30 a.m. on A1A, one block south of Las Olas Boulevard. The race route extends north along A1A to Sunrise Boulevard and finishes back at Las Olas Boulevard. Participants have the option to walk, run or paddleboard.
Registration for the event can be done on-line or in person at one of the packet pickup locations or on-site on race day. The deadline for online registration is November 22, 2015 . Registration ranges from $20 - $35 for adults, and the Kid's Dash is $5 .
If you are unavailable to participate in the 5k, there are volunteer and sponsorship opportunities. To find out more about the 5 th Annual Fort Lauderdale Turkey Trot and Paddle, visit http://www.turkeytrotftl.com .
About iTRACE Foundation, Inc.
iTRACE Foundation, Inc. (iTRACE) is a not for profit preventative health and wellness research foundation. Founded in 2009 by a small group of community conscious individuals, iTRACE is dedicated to improving the quality of living in the community. They work to achieve the following goals: to decrease childhood overweight and obesity, to increase physical activity across the lifespan, and to promote life-saving, low-cost preventive health measures.
About Leadership Broward Foundation, Inc.
Founded 33 years ago, Leadership Broward Foundation is the exclusive leadership organization offering youth and local business and community leaders at all levels the opportunity to connect to each other, develop valuable skills and make a positive impact on their organizations and community. The Foundation's programs and initiatives provide leadership skills development and increase awareness about local economic, political and social issues. Leadership Broward Foundation Alumni gain access to a diverse network of leaders and enjoy the opportunity to become strong leaders building great companies and a strong community.
